--- title: Extensor Hallucis Longus (EHL) --- ![Muscles of the lower leg @OpenStaxAnatomyPhysiology2022](/The Archive/Images/OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e/fig11.32 Muscles of the Lower Leg.jpeg){#fig-openstax-fig11.32} ![Intrinsic foot muscles @OpenStaxAnatomyPhysiology2022](/The Archive/Images/OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e/fig11.34 Intrinsic Muscles of the Foot.jpeg){#fig-openstax-fig11.34} :::{layout-ncol="3"} ![The Mucous sheaths of the tendons around the ankle (lateral view) @grayAnatomyHumanBody1918](/The Archive/Images/Gray anatomy 1918 images/Myology/image441 The mucous sheaths of the tendons around the ankle. Lateral aspect.gif) ![The Mucous sheaths of the tendons around the ankle (medial view) @grayAnatomyHumanBody1918](/The Archive/Images/Gray anatomy 1918 images/Myology/image442 The mucous sheaths of the tendons around the ankle. Medial aspect.gif) ::: ::: {.callout title="Reading list"} - Ch68 Long toe extensor muscles @donnellyTravellSimonsSimons2019 - Neuman @neumannKinesiologyMusculoskeletalSystem2017 - MMT @weinstockNeuroKineticTherapyInnovative2010 ::: ::: {#tbl-oian .cell message='false' execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Extensor Hallucis Longus Fibula (middle 1/3 of medial surface)
IO membrane		 Dorsal aponeurosis of 1st distal phalanx Deep Fibular n.
L4 - L5		 TCJ: DF
STJ: Inversion
1st Toe: MTP Extension, IP Extension
``` ::: ::: # Origin {#origin} - Fibula (middle third of the medial surface) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - IO membrane @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Insertion {#insertion} - 1st toe (*at the dorsal aponeurosis at the base of its distal phalanx*) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Nerve [Deep Fibular N.]({{< var ref-deep-fibular-nerve.path >}}) ([L4]({{< var ref-nerve-root.l4 >}}), [L5]({{< var ref-nerve-root.l5 >}})) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Action {#action} - **TCJ**: DF @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - **STJ**: INV or EV (*depending on initial position of foot*) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - **1st toe MTP and IP**: Extension @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # MMT "The EHL and the EHB muscles produce the motion of extension of the IP and MTP joints. The foot is maintained in midposition. Resistance is applied to the posterior aspect of both phalanges of the first digit into toe flexion." @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020
